DataElement.preferredName: Cell Fixed Specimen Prior To Reacting With Probe Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response to a question that asks if cells will be fixed before reacting with probes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cell Fixed Specimen Prior To Reacting With Probe
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin._Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._Reaction; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.:Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:Reaction; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A response generated by a stimulus.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.

General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes/ No/ Unknown/ Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Yes, no, unknown or not applicable responses to a question or condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

PermissibleValues.origin: LCBCC:Lung Cancer Biomarkers and Chemoprevention Consortium

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)
